result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Burton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 11/01/2016 along with payment plan fee of $15.00. Alternate 11 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court.   Defendant Christopher J Burton did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in count 1.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:  $456.50 plus $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge to be paid  at the rate of $100.00 a month commencing 11/01/2015 or alternate or 11 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant would like to represent himself and stated that the witnesses/victim will not be testifying against him. Defendant Christopher J Burton in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not eligible for the public defender's appointment. Defendant sworn. Defendant is requesting  the court to appoint counsel. Court denied the request. Court gives the defendant more time to hire counsel. Defendant stated on the record that he would like to resolve this matter and speak the DA assigned to this matter before he hires counsel.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
